name.tooltip: The name of the module for this application that will be loaded at runtime. This also determines the directory name of the generated application.

title.tooltip: The title of your application that is displayed in the header of the application.

namespace.tooltip: A unique package name for the application module being created. It should follow the standard Java package notation.

description.tooltip: Project description in package.json of your project

ui5Version.tooltip: Represents the minimum version of SAPUI5 that this application requires.

enableTypeScript.warningMsg: The CAP project will be updated to use NPM workspaces (this is a requirement for generating with TypeScript)

addDeployConfig.mtaMessage: Add deployment configuration to MTA project ({{-path}})

enableVirtualEndpoints.message: Use virtual endpoints for local preview
enableVirtualEndpoints.tooltip: Using virtual endpoints allows the generated application to use the latest features of SAP Fiori tools.

enableEslint.message: Add Eslint configuration to the project

enableCodeAssist.message: Add code assist libraries to your project

skipAnnotations.message: Skip generation of associated annotations.cds file

validators.appFolderExistsAtPath: A module with this name already exists in the folder: {{-path}}
validators.folderContainsFioriApp: The project folder path already contains an SAP Fiori application in the folder: {{-path}}. Please choose a different folder and try again.
validators.folderContainsCapApp: The selected project folder is part of an existing CAP project. This application must therefore use the local CAP project as the data source.
validators.windowsFolderPathTooLong: The combined length {{length}} of the target folder, namespace, and module name exceeds the default Windows paths length. This may cause issues with the project generation.
